dynasties: It follows the true stories of five of the world's most celebrated, yet endangered animals; penguins, chimpanzees, lions, painted wolves and tigers. Each in a heroic struggle against rivals and against the forces of nature, these families fight for their own survival and for the future of their dynasties.
big cats: It follows cat species from around the world, from the lions of Tanzania to the tiny rusty spotted cat of Sri Lanka.
blue planet two: David Attenborough returns to the world's oceans in this sequel to the acclaimed documentary filming rare and unusual creatures of the deep, as well as documenting the problems our oceans face.
planet earth two: David Attenborough returns in this breathtaking documentary showcasing life on Planet Earth.
the hunt: It shows the fascinating relationship between predators and their prey, and the strategies predators use to catch their food and prey use to escape death.
great barrier reef: David Attenborough revisits the Great Barrier Reef after nearly 60 years. His visit takes him from the most exposed part of the reef as well as down to 300m below the surface discovering corals never seen before.
wild alaska: it is based on the wildlife and experiences of the relaxing sculpture that is Alaska.
wild patagonia: The rugged terrain of South America's Patagonia region is an arid mix of mountains, deserts and coasts supporting a diverse animal population.
japan: earth's enchanted islands: it is about the natural world and wildlife of Japan's islands: Honshu, Hokkaido and the Southernmost Islands.
atlantic: the wildest ocean on earth: the BBC Natural History Unit explores a vast ocean that stretches nearly 10,000 miles, from Arctic to Antarctic and from sun-drenched tropical reefs to crushing abyssal depths.
shark: it documents the secret lives of sharks from the Arctic to the tropics, revealing their amazing diversity and sociability.
